name: df-wspthsnon
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(cwwspthsnon, cmpo(s0, s1, cn0, universe, cmpo(s2, s3, cfv(cvtx, cv(s1)), cfv(cvtx, cv(s1)), crab(s4, co(cv(s2), co(cv(s0), cwwlksnon, cv(s1)), cv(s3)), wex(s5, wbr(cv(s5), co(cv(s2), cfv(cspthson, cv(s1)), cv(s3)), cv(s4)))))))
bodyPretty: ‚ä¢ WSPathsNOn =(s0 ‚àà ‚Ñï0, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶(s2 ‚àà(Vtx ` s1), s3 ‚àà(Vtx ` s1)‚Ü¶ { s4 ‚àà(s2[(s0[WWalksNOn]s1)]s3)| ‚àÉ(s5, s5[(s2[(SPathsOn ` s1)]s3)]s4)}))
comment: Define the collection of simple paths of a fixed length with particular endpoints as word over the set of vertices. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 1-Mar-2018.) (Revised by AV, 11-May-2021.)
